speaker: JANE
line: Lauren, I've been looking everywhere! Are you all right? You want some water?

speaker: LAUREN
line: No, I'm fine.

speaker: JANE
line: Oh honey, it's been a couple of weeks now. Do you want to talk?

speaker: LAUREN
line: No. Really, Jane, I'm OK. It's just that I don't know a lot of people who have died, that's all. I've never known anyone that's killed themselves.

speaker: JANE
line: Oh, maybe after everything gets packed away it will get easier. There won't be a constant reminder. Here's your paycheck. Come on... go home.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Ok.

speaker: MALE
line: Hey... I know a great place to crash... up that fire escape. Come on. I'll give you a boost.

speaker: MAN
line: Agent Scully, Agent Mulder, Chief Blevins assures us of your cooperation. We regret any inconvenience at this extreme hour.

speaker: WOMAN
line: We hope your expertise in extraordinary phenomena matters will help us in our investigation.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're not FBI, are you?

speaker: SECOND WOMAN
line: Have you ever seen anything like this before? Abnormal post mortem muscle reflex. Both corpses are still responding to high levels of electrostatic charge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Any sign of external legions or surface burns?

speaker: SECOND WOMAN
line: None.

speaker: MULDER
line: Time of death?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it can't be long. The body's still warm.

speaker: SECOND WOMAN
line: Somatic death occurred sometime over 6 hours ago. Their body temperatures have yet to drop below 98.3 degrees.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you find them? Look, at least tell us the mode of transport. That might tell us why the bodies haven't cooled. Hey, you called us down here. If you want some answers you have to give some.

speaker: MAN
line: They traveled 60 minutes by air.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: SECOND WOMAN
line: The most troubling aspect of their deaths is the throat area. Larynx, esophagus, and hyoid bone all have been crushed like chalk. There is no evidence of tissue damage. It's as if their throats were crushed... from the inside.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are these guys?

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you've conducted your investigation, why consult us?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Because of your work on the X Files. Have you ever seen anything like this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, uh. Never.

speaker: MAN
line: Well, thank you for your time Agent Mulder, Scully. If any inquiry into this meeting be made, we request full denial.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd say you people already suffer from full denial.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You lied. You have seen this before, I can tell. You lied to them.

speaker: MULDER
line: I would never lie. I willfully participated in a campaign of misinformation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who do you think they were?

speaker: MULDER
line: NSA, CIA, some convert organization Congress will uncover in the next scandal. It's not important who they are but what they have and I'm sure they have no idea because they pulled us in. I have X Files. Each case with an element of what we saw tonight. Residual electrostatic charge, internal mutilation without any external causality - but none has all the elements combined in one case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How can the esophagus be crushed without the neck even being touched?

speaker: MULDER
line: Psychokinetic manipulation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Psychokinesis? You mean how Carrie got even at the prom?

speaker: MULDER
line: The Russians were doing studies on it. The Chinese still are. Their findings are kept secret.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ok, I'm intrigued. How can we investigate, we have nothing to go on.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Just getting in, Lauren? Mr. Graves used to let you get away with that but Mr. Dorland is in charge now. I was wondering if I could have a minute with him.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Tomorrow... at 3.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Can I see him today? It's really important.

speaker: MR. DORLAND
line: Is everything all right out here?

speaker: LAUREN
line: Can I speak with you?

speaker: DORLAND
line: Please.

speaker: LAUREN
line: I'm here to give my two week's notice.

speaker: DORLAND
line: Lauren, Jane told me about your crying in Howard's office and I wanted to tell you that you aren't alone. As a matter of fact, we share something special. Howard and I started this company 10 years ago and as long as I've known him he had no interest besides work. So we became like family. I was his brother and you were like a daughter to him. So, of course, I feel very close to you and I want to take care of my family. Stay, Lauren. Please, the company needs you. Especially now. I won't let you leave, Lauren.

speaker: LAUREN
line: What's wrong? I can't. I have to leave. I can't be here anymore.

speaker: DORLAND
line: You've got two weeks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mohamed Amalaki. Convictions: Illegal possession of firearms. Illegal possession of explosives. Falsification of export licenses.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He has ties to extremist group operating in the US. The Isfahan. They take their name from a city in Iran. Recently they've been working out of Philadelphia.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's 60 air minutes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll talk to the Philly P.D.

speaker: COP
line: It was last Wednesday night. I was on routine patrol. This is where we found them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who discovered their bodies?

speaker: COP
line: Nobody. It was about 10. I was on patrol. Just saw them hanging around. The folks that come around here, they don't witness very much. You hear what I'm saying?

speaker: MULDER
line: A daily visual record is made of everyone who makes a transaction.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We'll just have to interview everyone who was at the machine before 10 last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: There. Back up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lauren Kyte. 858 Franklin, Bensalem. Why would the Isfahan being robbing someone for 40 bucks at an ATM machine?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's another person.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe, maybe not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the resolution is too poor. It won't help much to enhance it.

speaker: MULDER
line: That leaves only one person we know we can talk to.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Miss Lauren Kyte, please. I'm Agent Fox Mulder and this is Agent Dana Scully. We're with the Federal Bureau of Investigation. Do you mind if we come in?

speaker: LAUREN
line: Um, I was just in the middle of...

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you. We won't be long.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you seen either of these two men before?

speaker: LAUREN
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Take your time.

speaker: LAUREN
line: I'm sorry. I've never seen them before.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm afraid you have. This is a surveillance picture from your ATM.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you tell us what happened that night?

speaker: LAUREN
line: Um... These guys, I was depositing my paycheck. They grabbed me, I got away. I ran. I just didn't want to file a report.

speaker: MULDER
line: They were found dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you ever seen this person before?

speaker: LAUREN
line: No. I'm sorry. I can't tell you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does that mean you know?

speaker: LAUREN
line: It means I can't tell who it is.

speaker: MULDER
line: When you can tell me, this is the number where I can be reached at anytime, ok?

speaker: LAUREN
line: Ah hum.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A woman her size breaking free and out running those men?

speaker: MULDER
line: And somehow crushing their necks?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She knows who the other person in that photo is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Packing, running away, from what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell's going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hang on! You ok?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi. The paramedics check you out?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I'm fine. Except I have a waiting-in-line-at-the-DMV-sized headache.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mine's more IRS sized.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They check out the car?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, it's brand new. Only a 100 miles.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then someone tampered with it while we were in her house.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mechanic said everything is in proper order. Nothing cut, nothing greased. Check out the lights.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They are on.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're not. The filaments are heated due to massive levels of electrostatic charge. Just like the bodies at the morgue. And isn't it interesting that Lauren Kyte was present at both incidents?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was in our presence the entire time we were at her house.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if it's possible somehow to raise a body's electrostatic charge to levels we've been seeing and use that energy to affect objects?

speaker: SCULLY
line: If a person could generate that much energy, their body would break down. They'd start glowing like those lights.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well there's evidence of this all through the X Files. Furniture moving untouched, objects levitating, unexplained electrical discharges. Frequently people who have psychokinetic power are unaware of their own capability.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying Lauren Kyte crashed our car?

speaker: MULDER
line: Either that or a poltergeist.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're here...

speaker: MULDER
line: They may be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, come on Mulder, look at the tangible evidence. Two Mid-East extremists are killed trying to assault a woman working for a manufacturer of parts for the Defense Department. While we questioned her our car is sabotaged. Now in both those cases, someone else may have committed those acts. Maybe the same someone we saw in those ATM photos. The mystery isn't psychokinetic energy, it's her accomplice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's clean. No arrest, not even a traffic ticket. The only thing is, she's in deep with her credit card company... $15,000.

speaker: LAUREN
line: No, no. I'll talk to somebody, just go.

speaker: MULDER
line: A little upset over losing a parking space, wouldn't you say? So, who is Howard Graves anyway?

speaker: MULDER
line: She was his secretary. That's three people dead in the last month all associated with Lauren Kyte.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't see too many bosses graves without people dancing on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at this one.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, Sir? Is there an office here so that I can get information on those people?

speaker: GROUNDSKEEPER
line: I attend every funeral. I'm the last person to see them put to rest.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know how Sarah Lynn is related to Howard Graves?

speaker: GROUNDSKEEPER
line: His daughter. They were at home one day and he didn't latch the pool gate. She drowned. His wife left him a year later. She's buried in a plot in the Northeast corner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you, Sir.

speaker: GROUNDSKEEPER
line: You're welcome.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was only three years old.

speaker: MULDER
line: If she'd lived, she'd be Lauren's age.

speaker: SCULLY (VOICE OVER)
line: Further investigation into Lauren Kyte's personal history reveals an estrangement from her family. Phone records confirm no contact with her parents for the last two years. Her actions observed during surveillance indicate a strong relationship between Lauren Kyte and her employer, the late Howard Graves. Was this relationship somehow the motivation for his suicide? How are the attack and the subsequent murders of the Isfahan agents related, if at all? I am certain that the answers to these questions lie in finding the identity of Lauren Kyte's accomplice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Enhance it by 10. That's Howard Graves. He's alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not necessarily.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Oh, Howard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think Howard Graves faked his own death.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know how difficult it is to fake your own death? Only one man has pulled it off, Elvis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He and Lauren Kyte are in on something. Maybe an illegal deal through his company. Something the CIA was interested in.

speaker: MULDER
line: You may be right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait, you think I'm right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sure, all you got to do is prove that Howard Graves is still alive.

speaker: ELLEN
line: Howard Graves is very dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: May we see the autopsy report, please?

speaker: ELLEN
line: Knock yourself out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cause of death... arterial hemorrhage...

speaker: ELLEN
line: 4 to 6 liters of blood down the tub.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well there seems to be some blood work missing here.

speaker: ELLEN
line: We only do that when we suspect homicide.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't suppose you ran any dental conformation?

speaker: ELLEN
line: What for? It was him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you know?

speaker: ELLEN
line: It said so on the toe tag.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who made positive ID on the body?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lauren Kyte.

speaker: MULDER
line: But Howard Graves was cremated. There would be no way to run a dental check or to get a DNA sample.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, there is. His body's tissues and organs were donated.

speaker: MAN
line: Howard Graves is in 5 different people. They harvested his organs immediately after death. His kidneys were sent to Boston, his liver to Dallas, and his corneas to Portland, Oregon. They've all been transplanted. Because of his age, we could only cryo-preserve the dura matter, the membrane of the spinal column. We have Mr. Graves' hospital records, we'll extract a sample, run a test and in a couple of hours... confirm the identity of the donor.

speaker: JANE
line: I knew you would rush, so I made sure to have your check before you leave. Oh, I'm going to miss you.

speaker: LAUREN
line: What? Here.

speaker: JANE
line: Bye.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Bye.

speaker: DORLAND
line: You're going to leave without saying goodbye? Well, I've come to say goodbye... to wish you luck, and to leave you with this little thought... I know Howard told you and if it ever gets out, I won't waste my time trying to pin the source. I'll go straight to you.

speaker: LAUREN
line: And you'll do to me what you did to Howard? I know you had him killed.

speaker: DORLAND
line: Why would you say that?

speaker: LAUREN
line: He told me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: LAUREN
line: It's Lauren Kyte. How soon can you get to my house?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: LAUREN
line: Please hurry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The tests are conclusive, the dura matter does belong to Howard Graves. He is indeed, very dead.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Just a second.

speaker: MAN
line: Go run the bath.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Get out of here! No!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, you're not under arrest. You're just here for questioning. The sooner you talk to us the sooner you get to go home. What happened to those people tonight? Do you have any idea who they might be. Why did they attack you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know who this is?

speaker: MAN
line: Scully, Mulder... He'll keep an eye on her. Come. Now.

speaker: WOMAN
line: You've seriously compromised our investigation.

speaker: MULDER
line: We were following leads pertaining to an X File.

speaker: MAN
line: I want to know every detail of your activities concerning this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What case? You're the ones who've been withholding information.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then we have nothing more to talk about.

speaker: WOMAN
line: We believe HTG Technologies was selling restricted parts to the Isfahan. Partial serial numbers from their manifest were recovered in the wreckage of a July bombing of a Navy transport van.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's Lauren Kyte involved?

speaker: MAN
line: We don't quite know. Your actions impeded our investigation.

speaker: WOMAN
line: In any case, we don't have enough evidence to hold her. If she doesn't talk, she goes free and we lose our chance to break this company.

speaker: MAN
line: I could make her talk.

speaker: MULDER
line: My advise to you. Don't get rough with her. LATER

speaker: WOMAN
line: That was a waste of time.

speaker: MAN
line: Your turn.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lauren?

speaker: LAUREN
line: I won't talk to you, either.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ok, then you're free to go.

speaker: LAUREN
line: I can't go back to that house.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? Because of Howard Graves?

speaker: LAUREN
line: He's dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know. He's watching over you, isn't he? LATER

speaker: LAUREN
line: I don't know if you've ever been a secretary. Sometimes your boss can talk as if you weren't even in the room, which can hurt, you know? Sometimes... you're all he has to talk to. Which is how it was all the time with me and Howard. One night, late, I went into his office. He was crying, more scared than sad. The Pentagon contracts were being canceled, the company was going under, he felt personally responsible for each of his employees... seeing and feeling their fear every day... it really wore him down. Then this one time, Dorland came with that group... that Mid East group... Isfahan, that terrorist group. They'd buy parts at an outrageous price. Not just once, but for as long as they could get away with it. That night Howard was crying, he'd just found out the Isfahan had just claimed responsibility for killing a couple of sailors in Florida. He was never the same. And I thought that was why he killed himself. But he didn't... I saw... Howard showed me how Dorland had him killed. Made it look like a suicide because he see Howard was going to put an end to the deal.

speaker: MULDER
line: So now Howard is protecting you?

speaker: LAUREN
line: It sounds so ridiculous.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you believe it.

speaker: LAUREN
line: He was closer to me than my father. I told him that. I still feel his presence. Sometimes... I even smell his aftershave. If you just could've... seen... the things I've seen... I just... want all that to go away. I'm leaving. Maybe he can move on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not enough. You've been given the chance to tell him again. Take it. Tell him you love him, by showing him, by... helping us finish his unfinished business. Lauren, how will you ever be able to rest if he never can?

speaker: LAUREN
line: Ok. I'm a mess. I'm um, going to wash up.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you doing Scully? You don't believe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there's no such thing as ghosts or psychokinesis. I'm sure there's an explanation. But I believe that she believes. And my priority is to get her to help us stop Dorland.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well we may have just sacrificed our best opportunity to observe spectral phenomena.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm giving us a chance to solve a case that's tangible instead of chasing after shadows.

speaker: MULDER
line: You ready?

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, everyone. We have a warrant to search the premises for evidence of the sale of restricted manufactured parts. The evidence may be in the form of falsified export licences, parts manifests, communiques. It could be on computer disks or hard copy.

speaker: MAN
line: Once there, when in doubt, ask. We need this to be clean. This is the culmination of a year long investigation. If we don't come out of there today with something proving a connection to the Isfahan, this guy could walk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lets go. Now, it will most likely be in Dorland's office. We'll conduct the search, but we need you to guide us so we need you to be strong, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Everybody stay calm. Federal Bureau of Investigation. Ma'am, could you step away from those files, please? DORLAND'S OFFICE LATER

speaker: WOMAN
line: This is all we could find.

speaker: MULDER
line: We don't have him. He's not even breaking a sweat.

speaker: MAN
line: Our case is blown. A wasted year. This guy is going to walk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's get out of here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lauren, it's over. We have to go. What we're looking for isn't here.

speaker: DORLAND
line: Look! She isn't an agent. I've been more than cooperative and I don't want to be combative, but she has no right destroying my personal property.

speaker: LAUREN
line: Destroying property? What about that van that blew up and killed those servicemen?

speaker: DORLAND
line: Oh, I don't know what you're talking about you stupid bitch!

speaker: MULDER
line: Lauren, No!

speaker: LAUREN
line: Don't kill him. Help us find it!

speaker: MULDER
line: Get down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: SCULLY
line: My God.

speaker: MULDER
line: I guess what we're looking for is here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The US Attorney's office is going after Dorland with everything they've got. Including the murder of Howard Graves.

speaker: LAUREN
line: I'll come back to testify.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you going?

speaker: LAUREN
line: Away from here. Thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Boy, she's in a rush to get out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Out of here, or away from the ghost of Howard Graves?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. Do you believe in the afterlife?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd settle for a life in this one.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you ever seen the liberty bell?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, I've been to Philadelphia a 100 times and I've never seen it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not missing much. It's just a big bell with a big crack, and you have to wait in a long line.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but I'd really like to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why now?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. How late do you think they stay open?

speaker: HEAD SECRETARY
line: Miss Kyte, I asked for this 25 minutes ago.

speaker: LAUREN
line: I know. I'm sorry.

speaker: HEAD SECRETARY
line: Maybe that's the way they work back in the East, but here in the Midwest, punctuality is a virtue. We really need to find a new office space. Every time a truck goes by the whole building shakes. That's all Lauren.
